Strings.ApplicationErrorsInfo: Something is causing errors.\nSee log file for more information.
Strings.EarlyAccessText:
Ricave is currently in development.

I constantly try to add more content, rebalance things, cut mechanics which aren't enjoyable, and gather feedback, but I probably missed something still. If you find the game too hard or too easy, encounter a bug, or have an awesome idea for an improvement or a new feature, then please participate in the development process and share your thoughts on our Discord channel or Twitter.

Thanks and enjoy!
~Piotr "ison" Walczak
Strings.VersionMismatchText: Ricave has been updated to version {0}!\n\nYour current run may or may not be compatible with the new version. Do you want to abandon your current run and return to lobby?
Strings.ConfirmReturnToLobby:
Are you sure you want to return to lobby?

Unlike returning to lobby in-game, using this option here means you will lose your progress for your current run. You won't lose the overall lobby progress though (your previous quests and stardust will remain intact).

Use this option if your savefile is corrupted e.g. after installing an incompatible update.
Strings.ConfirmResetAllProgress:
Are you sure you want to reset ALL progress?

This will erase all your data and you'll start from the beginning.

Only use this option if you want to experience the game from scratch, or if your progress data is corrupted.
Strings.PressKeyToAssignTo: Press a key to assign to:
Strings.PrivateRoomInfo: Press [ShowInventory] to open the shop menu.
Strings.DailyChallengeTitle: You have one attempt - make it count!
Strings.DailyChallengeExplanation:
Every day, players around the world get to play the same dungeon seed. You only get one chance per day.

Rules:
 - Normal difficulty
 - Boosts disabled
 - Random class and traits
 - Quests disabled
 - Progress disabled
 - Endless complex dungeon (no floor limit)

You can't collect stardust in this dungeon and it won't count towards your stats, but you'll receive {0} for participation.
Strings.DailyChallengeAlreadyPlayed: You've already played today's challenge\nYour score was: {0}
Strings.NoFriendsPlayed: None of your friends have played this challenge yet.
Strings.QuestsAvailableTip: Use the quest log to accept quests.
Strings.LockedTraitTip: You need to unlock this trait first.\n\nYou can buy a random trait for stardust. The more traits you already have, the more expensive it is to buy the next one.
Strings.MaxFloorReachedWithTraitTip: Max floor you've reached with this trait: {0}
Strings.TraitsLimitReached: You can only choose up to 2 traits.
Strings.ClickToSelectTrait: Click to select or unselect this trait.
Strings.ConfirmBuyRandomTraits: Do you really want to buy {1} random traits for {0}?
Strings.TraitLastStand: Deal {0} more damage when below {1} HP
Strings.TraitMaxHPOffsetPerLevel_Less: Gain {0} less max HP per level
Strings.TraitMaxHPOffsetPerLevel_More: Gain {0} more max HP per level
Strings.CosmeticsInfo: Cosmetics are purely visual and have no gameplay effects, unless otherwise stated.
Strings.ConfirmBuyCosmetic: Do you want to buy {0} for {1}?
Strings.CosmeticWillMakeFactionHostile: Warning: This cosmetic will make {0} hostile to you
Strings.DemonNoteText:
Your time is borrowed.
I'm merely collecting my debt.
By all means, keep running.
Eventually, you'll find the exit.
I'm just beyond it.
Strings.CantUnequipCursedItems: You can't unequip {0} items (without curse removal scroll).
Strings.QuestCompletedTip: Claim your reward when you're back in the lobby
Strings.BuyConfirmation: Do you want to buy {0} for {1}?
Strings.BuyConfirmation_SingleUseUnlockable: This is a single-use bonus and it only applies to your next run.
Strings.NativeWeaponDescription: This is this character's native weapon.
Strings.ChooseSpellWheelSelectorText: Choose a new spell.\n\nYou can choose a new spell every time you level up.
Strings.FirstTip: Use [MoveForward][MoveLeft][MoveBack][MoveRight] to move. Press [ShowInventory] to open inventory. Use [Interact] to interact with objects. Rotate with [RotateLeft] and [RotateRight]. Hold [Inspect] to inspect. Press [Wait] to wait a turn.
Strings.CantDescendBecausePartyCantReach: Some party members are too far
Strings.Intro1: You appear to be in some sort of dungeon...
Strings.Intro2: You don't know where you are exactly, or even how you ended up here.
Strings.Intro3: Everything around feels somewhat dreamy. At the same time, it feels a bit too real to be just a dream.
Strings.Intro4: You slowly start to remember something. At least you know your name.
Strings.Intro6: You've just noticed someone in the distance, but you only caught a glimpse of his shadow. You should better check it out.
Strings.Ending2: You wake up in a hospital.

Ending5.i: "You went for a hike with your friends and had a serious head injury."

Ending6.i: "The rescuers found you just in time. You need to rest and regain your strength."

Ending9.i: "She found me first. Is she okay?"

Ending10.i: "You may be experiencing some confusion, but you'll recover soon."

Strings.Ending12: You are puzzled, yet you have this strange sense of accomplishment. Almost like you've changed in some way.
Strings.Ending13: You close your eyes and take a deep breath, imagining the warmth of the sun on your face. The fresh air fills your lungs and you can't help but smile.
Strings.MemoryPiece1: The forest... bingo! You start to remember what happened before you got here. A warm summer day, birds singing, and beautiful mountains on the horizon - you went on a hike with your friends. But then, something caught your attention. You remember separating from the group. But why?
Strings.MemoryPiece2: The cave! You left your group after hearing someone shout for help. Believing it was another hiker in trouble, you followed the voice to a cave. Inside, you slipped and fell, breaking your leg. You called out, but no one answered. Alone and hurt, your hope began to fade...
Strings.MemoryPiece3: You sat alone in that cave for hours. When night came and rain started pouring, you almost lost all your hope. After what felt like forever, you saw a light at the cave entrance. It was... Maya! You were so relieved!
Strings.MemoryPiece4: You were overjoyed to see Maya. She reached out to pull you up, and for a moment, it seemed like you would make it. But the relentless rain made her slip and you both tumbled down, striking the rocks with painful force. After that, everything went silent.
Strings.Name: Name
Strings.EquipmentTabTip: See all items you currently have equipped.
Strings.CraftingTabTip: See all recipes you can use to craft new items. It may be useful if you need to remove a curse or heal a missing limb.
Strings.IdentificationTabTip:
See all unidentified items you have in your inventory.

Every item slowly becomes identified over time (unless you're hungry). The item at the top of the list will be identified first.

Drag and drop to reorder.
Strings.NoUnidentifiedItems: You don't have any unidentified items
Strings.IdentificationQueueExplanation: This is your identification queue. Drag and drop to decide which item should be identified next as time passes. You can also identify items at wanderers.
Strings.PlaceLinkTip: If you choose to go this way, you'll receive the following
Strings.FallIntoDescendTriggerConfirmation: This move will make you fall into the pit. Do you really want to do it?\n\nYou'll drop into a random place on the floor below and lose some health. You can't come back.
Strings.MoveIntoRunEndPortalConfirmation: This move will end your run. Do you really want to do it?
Strings.NeverInspectedAnythingTip: Remember to inspect your surroundings with [Inspect].
Strings.TextOnFirstTimeFloorReached_1: What is this place? I must find the way out...
Strings.TextOnFirstTimeFloorReached_2: Every time I come here, this dungeon changes. But why?
Strings.TextOnFirstTimeFloorReached_3: Every step feels eerily familiar, almost as if I've been here before.
Strings.TextOnFirstTimeFloorReached_4: There's something up ahead, I can feel it.
Strings.TextOnFirstTimeFloorReached_5: Did I just win a battle or understand something?
Strings.TextOnFirstTimeFloorReached_6: I feel like everything's led to what lies ahead.
Strings.TextOnFirstTimeFloorReached_7: I feel like... a weight's been lifted off my mind. Strange.
Strings.AcceptQuestsInLobbyInfo: You can accept and postpone quests in the lobby.
Strings.QuestsRequireDungeonFloorInfo: Note that some quests can only be completed in dungeons that have enough floors.
Strings.ExtraQuest_UnlockNextDungeonDesc: Reach the end of floor {0} of this dungeon to unlock the next one.
Strings.ExtraQuest_FindPuzzlePieceDesc: Find the next puzzle piece on floor {0}. You currently have {1}/{2} of them.
Strings.ExtraQuest_SetSpiritsFreeDesc_One: There's 1 spirit in this dungeon. Set it free by bringing it to the shelter.
Strings.ExtraQuest_SetSpiritsFreeDesc_Multiple: There are {0} spirits in this dungeon. Set them free by bringing them to the shelter.
Strings.TheseFollowersWillBeLeftBehind: Warning: These followers will be left behind
Strings.StardustInfo:
You've collected stardust - a precious currency!

Stardust can be spent in the lobby to buy boosts for your next runs and unlock special rooms.

All items marked with "Lobby item" carry over to the lobby. All other items are lost when the run ends.
Strings.PuzzlePieceInfo: Puzzle pieces, just like stardust, are permanent lobby items.\n\nCollect all {0} of them across different runs to unlock a secret room in the lobby.
Strings.PetRatInfo:
You have a companion.

Whenever you move, Roko will automatically collect gold coins in the adjacent tiles for you.

1 cheese makes Roko follow you only for 1 run.
Strings.PartyInfo: You now have party members.\n\nYou can switch between them and manage their inventory separately. Each party member takes their turn independently.
Strings.MemoryPieceHereHint: There's a Memory Piece on this floor
Strings.DiscoveredEntitiesTip: Codex shows items and creatures in their typical, non-cursed state. Actual items/creatures may differ.
Strings.MaxFloorReachedWithClassTip: Max floor you've reached with this class: {0}
Strings.MaxFloorReachedWithoutClassTip: Max floor you've reached without a class: {0}
Strings.CursedItemIdentifiedAfterEquipping: {0} is {1}! (you need to find or craft a curse removal scroll)
Strings.EntityHasAlreadyBeenUsed: {0} fizzles but doesn't seem to have any effect
Strings.LeveledUp_CanChooseNewSpell: You can choose a new spell.
Strings.ShieldRemovedBecauseHarmed: Shield effect has been canceled because you harmed {0}
Strings.TrialCompleted: You've completed the trial and received {0}
Strings.GlyphsCompleted: You've solved the glyph puzzle and received {0}
Strings.DevilStatueAcceptedItem: The devil statue accepts your {0} and gives you {1}
Strings.MissingIngredients: You don't have all the ingredients
Strings.DroppedItemInInvalidSlot: This item doesn't fit in this slot
Strings.YouGainedSkillPoint: You've gained a skill point! Open inventory to spend it.
Strings.ItemRampUpUpgraded: The level of {0} has been upgraded
Strings.CannotUnequipCursedItem: You can't unequip a cursed item
Strings.CanSurpriseAttackDesc: This character didn't see you in the previous turn, so you will deal {0} more damage to them if you attack now.
Strings.AboveYouDesc: This character is currently above you, which means they'll deal {0} more damage if they hit you from this position.
Strings.BelowYouDesc: This character is currently below you, which means you'll deal {0} more damage if you hit them from this position.
Strings.CantSeePlayerDesc: This character doesn't see you (they can't see as far as you). But beware - they may still remember your last position and want to go check it!
Strings.FallingDesc: This character is falling, which means that their next turn will have to be spent on falling down instead of performing an action.
Strings.UnidentifiedConditionDesc: An unknown effect. It comes from an unidentified item.
Strings.SurroundedBonusDesc: You're surrounded by at least 2 enemies, which means you'll deal {0} more damage to this character if you hit them from this position.
Strings.UnidentifiedUseEffectDesc: An unknown effect. It comes from an unidentified item.
Strings.PlayerHealthTip: This is your character's hit points.\n\nCertain items may increase your maximum hit points. Each level gives you {0} to max hit points.
Strings.PlayerHealthRegenTip: If not hungry or starving, {0} will be healed every {1}.
Strings.LosingHPBecauseAboveMaxTip: You're losing health because it's above the maximum level.
Strings.LosingManaBecauseAboveMaxTip: You're losing mana because it's above the maximum level.
Strings.LosingStaminaBecauseAboveMaxTip: You're losing stamina because it's above the maximum level.
Strings.ItemIdentificationTip: This item will be identified after {0}. Drag and drop to reorder.
Strings.ItemUnidentifiedDescChoices: This item is {0}. However, thanks to your impeccable perception you can tell that it's one of the following:
Strings.IdentificationGroupsBecomeIdentifiedDesc: Items like this become permanently identified once used.
Strings.ItemUnidentifiedDesc: This item is {0}. It can have unknown effects and be {1} (you can't unequip {1} items). Wanderers can help you with identification.
Strings.ItemCursedDesc: This item is {0}. You can't unequip {0} items (without curse removal scroll).
Strings.SignTexts: Congrats!;You can do it!;I've always believed in you!;Almost there!;I wish I was as awesome as you!;Impressive!;Keep it going!;You're the best!;You made it!;Nice one!;You’re awesome!
Strings.Sign_FloorOne:
Welcome to floor 1.

Your journey starts here, even though it may not be the first time you read this sign.

Some things may seem difficult at first, but that's okay. Above all, we must remember - losing is fun!
Strings.Sign_Shelter: Here, every soul pauses to find its way.
Strings.PlayerGoldTip: The number of gold coins you have in your inventory. There may be some people willing to trade in this dungeon.
Strings.ChangeAltitudeTip: Press [Fly]+[MoveForward] to go up and [Fly]+[MoveBack] to go down.
Strings.UsingThisItemCostsNoTurn: Using this item takes no turn.
Strings.UsingThisItemCostsXOfATurn: Using this item takes {0} of a turn.
Strings.UsingThisSpellCostsNoTurn: Using this spell takes no turn.
Strings.UsingThisSpellCostsXOfATurn: Using this spell takes {0} of a turn.
Strings.UsingThisNativeWeaponCostsXOfATurn: Doing this takes {0} of a turn.
Strings.InteractingWithThisStructureCostsNoTurn: Interacting with this object takes no turn.
Strings.InteractingWithThisStructureCostsXOfATur: Interacting with this object takes {0} of a turn.
Strings.InteractingWithThisStructureCostsXTurns: Interacting with this object takes {0} turns.
Strings.AllowUseOnlyIfNotSeenByHostilesTip: You can use it only if nobody sees you.
Strings.FragileEntityTip: This object is fragile (explosions will destroy it).
Strings.IdentificationStoppedTip: Identification has stopped because you're hungry.
Strings.DestroyOnDescendItemTip: This item will disappear after descending.
Strings.PlayerHungerTip:
This is your current satiation level: {0}/{1}

You need to eat periodically to satisfy your hunger and avoid consequences.

Once the satiation level reaches {2}, you become hungry - you won't regenerate health or identify items.

Once the satiation level reaches {3}, you become starving - you won't regenerate stamina and you will slowly lose health over time.
Strings.DungeonFloorTip: This is the current dungeon floor. The lower you go, the harder it becomes to survive, but also the more fun it gets!
Strings.AngeringFactionTip: Warning: If killed, all members of this faction will become hostile.
Strings.FollowerTip: This character will follow you to the next floor.
Strings.PlayerManaTip:
This is your character's mana.

Casting spells and using magical items costs mana. Mana doesn't regenerate automatically over time, it can only be refilled by drinking mana potions or by interacting with some special objects. The mana bar is hidden when you don't have any spells.

You can choose a new spell every time you level up.
Strings.PlayerStaminaTip: This is your character's stamina.\n\nUsing certain items may require stamina. The stamina bar is hidden when you don't have any items requiring stamina in your inventory.
Strings.PlayerStaminaRegenTip: If not starving, {0} will regenerate every {1}.
Strings.AddSpellButtonTip: Choose a new spell. You can choose a new spell every time you level up.
Strings.RewindTip:
The watch lets you rewind time at your will! Rewind the last turn by pressing [Rewind].

Use it whenever you don't like the outcome of your recent actions or you simply missclicked.

The watch has a limit for how many turns you can rewind at once, but it recharges every {0} turns. Unlike other time-manipulation items like rewind scrolls, watch loses all its remaining charges whenever you use an unidentified potion or scroll, equip a cursed item, step on a trap, or use a silver key.

All actions in Ricave are deterministic, which means that after rewinding, everything will play out exactly the same as before if you make the same move again, including dealing the same damage and enemies making the same decisions. Rewinding time just to roll a higher dealt damage won't work.
Strings.StardustTip: Stardust can be found in various places in the dungeon or can be offered as a reward for completing a quest. You can spend stardust in the lobby.
Strings.PuzzlePiecesTip: Collect all {0} puzzle pieces to unlock a special room in the lobby. There's one puzzle piece on each floor of the dungeon, and you can only find one piece per run.
Strings.PickUpPrivateRoomStructureTip: Pick up placed objects in your private room.
Strings.CompassTip:
You are currently facing {0}.

Move with "[MoveForward][RotateLeft][MoveBack][RotateRight]".
Strafe with "[MoveLeft]" and "[MoveRight]".
Go up and down with "[Fly]+[MoveForward]" and "[Fly]+[MoveBack]" if your character can fly.
Strings.StaminaRegenDisabledBecauseNotTouchingGr: Stamina regeneration is disabled because this character is not touching the ground.
Strings.StaminaRegenDisabledBecausePlayerNotTouc: Stamina regeneration is disabled because you're not touching the ground.
Strings.YouDontHaveAnySkillPoints: You don't have any skill points
Strings.EscapingModeTip: All the gates are open and everyone is awake. You have to escape now!\n\nAdditionally, twice as many rats will spawn.
Strings.PetRatTip: Roko will collect gold coins in the adjacent tiles for you whenever you move.
Strings.CheckInCodexTip: Tip: You can check codex for typical stats

Strings.NameGenerator3: clutch, worth, yard, son, barble, mark, ton, bon, gon, hoof, stein, been, snapper, blob, poof, laugh, bach, dory, snarf, flop, plop, boof, blat, snark, bork
Strings.SpiritNameGenerator: Laughter, Change, Hope, Solitude, Harmony, Resolve, Joy, Fear, Anger, Sadness, Love, Surprise, Disgust, Curiosity, Hope, Despair, Trust, Skepticism, Courage, Guilt, Shame, Gratitude, Envy, Relief, Boredom, Calmness, Nostalgia, Resilience, Empathy, Anticipation, Regret, Awe, Humility, Frustration, Contempt
